tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE ProvisioningTemplates (
    template_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    infrastructure_type VARCHAR(50),
    resource_name VARCHAR(100),
    provision_script TEXT,
    container_image VARCHAR(200)
)

CREATE TABLE vm_templates (
    template_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    template_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    os VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    memory_gb INT NOT NULL,
    cpu_cores INT NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE vm_templates (
    template_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    template_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    os_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    cpu_cores INT NOT NULL,
    ram_gb INT NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE container_templates (
    template_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    template_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    image_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    ports VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    environment_variables VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE virtual_machines (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    cpu_count INT NOT NULL,
    memory_gb INT NOT NULL,
    os VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE containers (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    image VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    cpu_limit INT NOT NULL,
    memory_limit INT NOT NULL,
    status VARCHAR(20)
);

CREATE TABLE templates (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    os_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    template_data JSONB
);

CREATE TABLE vm_templates (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    template_id INT NOT NULL,
    vm_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    storage_gb INT NOT NULL,
    CONSTRAINT fk_template FOREIGN KEY (template_id) REFERENCES templates(id)
);

CREATE TABLE container_templates (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    template_id INT NOT NULL,
    container_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    environment_vars JSONB,
    CONSTRAINT fk_template FOREIGN KEY (template_id) REFERENCES templates(id)
);
